dt: {bc}the aspect in which a thing is measurable in terms of greater, less, or equal or of increasing or decreasing magnitude
{bc}an individual considered with respect to a given situation
{bc}duration and intensity of speech sounds as distinct from their individual quality or phonemic character
{bc}the relative length or brevity of a prosodic syllable in some languages (such as Greek and Latin)
{bc}the relative duration or time length of a speech sound or sound sequence
{bc}the character of a logical proposition as being universal, particular, or singular

et: Middle English {it}quantite{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}quantité{/it}, from Latin {it}quantitat-, quantitas{/it}, from {it}quantus{/it} how much, how large; akin to Latin {it}quam{/it} how, as, {it}quando{/it} when, {it}qui{/it} who {ma}{mat|who|}{/ma}
